title: Automation and Human Performance
content: Automation changes human roles from active controller to monitor and exception handler. Monitoring is cognitively demanding and humans are poor at sustained vigilance. Automation can also reduce skill maintenance. Effective automation supports humans rather than replacing their judgment entirely.

mcq.question: A highly automated system requires operators only during failures. Why is this problematic?

options.B: Operators lose skills and situational awareness needed to intervene effectively during failures
options.D: Automation failures are simple to handle

mcq.explanation: Ironies of automation: it's most needed during failures but degrades the human capability to handle them. Passive monitoring erodes skills and awareness. Design should keep operators appropriately engaged.

openQuestions: How does automation affect skill maintenance in your operation?
What keeps operators engaged enough to intervene effectively?
